thread.title: Murder confession called into newsroom
thread.title_full: Murder confession called into newsroom - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Murder confession called into newsroom
text:
MILWAUKEE (WISN/CNN) - There are new leads in a decades-old cold case after a man called in details about a girl's death to a news station.
Carrie Ann Jopek went missing at age 13 in March of 1982.
A man called WISN in Milwaukee and identified himself as a neighbor who lived across the street from Carrie Ann.
He said he went to a party with her the night she died, and that she fell and broke her neck. He said he had sex with her because he thought she was unconscious, but when he realized she was dead, he buried her.
The news is sad relief for Carrie Ann's mother, Caroyln Tousignant.
"He said he did it. He admitted it finally after how long? Thirty-three years," Tousignant said.
Tousignant said the day Carrie Ann went missing, she got a call from her school saying Carrie Ann had been suspended for skipping class.
"I figured she'll be home, but she never showed up," Tousignant said.
A year later, a contractor was working on a porch across the street from her home when he discovered a girl's body in the dirt.
Tousignant stood by as police unearthed her daughter.
"She's in God's hands right now. No more worrying where she is," Tousignant said.
Tousignant said she knows the man who called in as Junior.
"Oh, my God. He always said that she was haunting him," Tousignant said.
The man is now 50 years old and once told her he and some friends were with Carrie Ann when she hit her head and died. But he wouldn't tell police.
"They were drinking, they were all drinking Yukon Jack and smoking weed. They got scared, so they grabbed a dry cleaning bag, wrapped her up in that and dug a hole under the porch and buried her," Tousignant said.
12 News contacted police after the man's call but aren't naming him because he hasn't been charged. However, police confirmed the man is in custody on the preliminary charge of homicide.
Copyright 2015 WISN, family photos and CNN.
